alert.note: Alert for Absaroka Mountains; Upper Wind River Basin; Wind River Basin; Wind River Mountains East (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 20 at 7:54PM MDT by NWS Riverton
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT WEST CENTRAL HOT SPRINGS... NORTHWESTERN FREMONT AND SOUTH CENTRAL PARK COUNTIES THROUGH 830 PM MDT... At 754 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles east of Dubois, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of west central Hot Springs, northwestern Fremont and south central Park Counties, including the following locations... Double Cabin Campground. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Absaroka Mountains; Upper Wind River Basin; Wind River Basin; Wind River Mountains East
